texts.definition: Resources which several players have access to during a game instance, either continuously or at varying times.
markups: <style="Definition">Resources which several players have access to during a game instance, either continuously or at varying times.</style>

Resources are a common component of game designs, and used by players to perform various actions. Resources that are available to several different players – either with or without the players consent to this – are <style="CurrentLink">Shared Resources</style>.

In the board game <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Space%20Alert">Space Alert</link></style>, the energy used to power shields and lasers come from a common source, making it a <style="CurrentLink">Shared Resource</style>. In team-based <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:FPS%20Games">FPS Games</link></style> such as the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Left%204%20Dead%20series">Left 4 Dead series</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Battlefield%20series">Battlefield series</link></style> the players in each team need to shared ammunition and health kits (in the former game) and vehicles (in the later game).

<style="CurrentLink">Shared Resources</style> are introduced to make players have to deal with the complexity of having <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> that other players also can manipulate. This rather obviously changes perceptions of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Ownership">Ownership</link></style> of said resources, but can also heavily influence the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Social%20Interaction">Social Interaction</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Social%20Organizations">Social Organizations</link></style> present in a game. They can also affect or create <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Alliances">Alliances</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="mutual-goals">Mutual Goals</link></style> when players can agree on trying to use the <style="CurrentLink">Shared Resources</style> in a controlled way together. Examples of <style="CurrentLink">Shared Resources</style> includes <style="Link"><link="lives">Lives</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="extra-chances">Extra Chances</link></style> which whole <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style> shares, as are the elements placed in common bags as part of <style="Link"><link="bag-building">Bag Building</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="mutual-goals">Mutual Goals</link></style> can also be used to modulate <style="CurrentLink">Shared Resources</style> by simply given such goals to the players that have the <style="CurrentLink">Shared Resources</style>.

<style="Link"><link="penalties">Penalties</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="rewards">Rewards</link></style> can be modified by <style="CurrentLink">Shared Resources</style> by having their effects apply on these. Perhaps more naturally they can be the target of both <style="Link"><link="shared-penalties">Shared Penalties</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="shared-rewards">Shared Rewards</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Shared Resources</style> can lead to <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Competition">Competition</link></style> in the form of <style="Link"><link="resource-competition">Resource Competition</link></style>, and thereby <style="Link"><link="tension">Tension</link></style>. It can also lead to <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Negotiation">Negotiation</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Social%20Interaction">Social Interaction</link></style> focused upon those <style="CurrentLink">Shared Resources</style>, and when this occurs may spread to players taking on different <style="Link"><link="social-roles">Social Roles</link></style> related to the <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> or putting them in situations of <style="Link"><link="social-dilemmas">Social Dilemmas</link></style>. Such <style="Link"><link="social-dilemmas">Social Dilemmas</link></style> are even more common in games where players not only have <style="CurrentLink">Shared Resources</style> but also need to engage in <style="Link"><link="cooperation">Cooperation</link></style>, and this may further increase <style="Link"><link="tension">Tension</link></style> since players may have <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Inherent%20Mistrust">Inherent Mistrust</link></style> of each other.

That others can use <style="CurrentLink">Shared Resources</style> can effectively make <style="Link"><link="time-limits">Time Limits</link></style> exist on how long players have access to these <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style>. The presence of <style="CurrentLink">Shared Resources</style> also make the players with access to them have <style="Link"><link="symmetric-resource-distribution">Symmetric Resource Distribution</link></style> regarding those <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style>.
